result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan Isaac Curley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ethan Isaac Curley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ethan Isaac Curley was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Ethan Isaac Curley appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances. Also has 15 CF 55. No additions or corrections to the PSI.   Victim John Jacobson speaks to the court.  State speaks re: sentencing, court speaks to the parties requesting 3 years probation. Nothing further from the state. Atty Chapman speaks to the court re: sentencing asking to follow the PSI and recommends 2 years probation.  Defendant speaks to the court.  Court sentences the defendant.
15 CF 15--30 Months probation. Conditions: 83 Days Jail, Credit 83 days. AODA Assessment. Absolute Sobriety. Cognitive Behavioral class. Not to possess/consume any controlled substances or alcohol. DNA Sample and Surcharge.  $100.00 Fine + Court costs.
15 CF 55--12 months probation. Concurrent w/ 15 CF 15.  $100.00 fine + court costs.
Sentencing hearing on July 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Ethan Isaac Curley in court, in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Court reviews files. Court revokes bail.
to Withdraw as Counsel
& Affidavit to Withdraw as Counsel

Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  No appearance by defendant.  Atty Gramstrup speaks to the court. State speaks to the court.  Warrant issued. Body only. Extraditable.
Sentencing hearing at 03-23-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant, Ethan Isaac Curley appeared with Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 15 CF 55.  Court questions Mr. Curley re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. 
Court finds there is a factual basis.  
15 CF 15-Def. pleas no contest, court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 
15 CF 55-Def. pleas no contest, court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 

Court orders a PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant, Ethan Isaac Curley appeared with Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Also has 15 CF 55.  8:06 AM Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Hoffman waived preliminary exam in both these matters.  Court advised the defendant as to his right to a preliminary exam.  Defendant does not wish to have a preliminary exam.  Court finds defendant has knowingly waived his right to a prelim - finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 11:45 am.
